comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Virginia Myers (21 October 1906-) was a dancer before she was five years old. Her parents were artists in New York City (Jerome Myers was a painter, Ethel Myers was a sculptor), who encouraged their daughter's expressive movements with private, and eventually public, exhibitions. She danced for an early film. In 1916, there was a Vanity Fair article about her. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerome_Myers en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User:BEDownes/Ethel_Myers en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Ethel_Myers_%26_Daughter_5_yea... ques.com/myers/html/virginia.html www.imdb.com/title/tt1056052/ A much later photo of her, still dancing: www.loc.gov/pictures/item/agc1996000079/PP/

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: see also: www.zoominfo.com/#!search/profile/person?personId=2830450... Is she still living?

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Seems unlikely, but I guess she was an unlikely person! I've seen 1975 listed as her date of death; would like to find an obituary or gravesite to be sure. Her father died in 1940, from a fall; her mother died in 1962; they had a grandson, Barry Downes, who is still alive and must be the son of Virginia Myers. He's been working on wikipedia entries about his grandparents, and he's surely the one to ask. Couple more links about Jerome: www.delart.org/collections/HFS_library/finding_aids/jerom... giam.typepad.com/100_years_of_illustration/2011/05/jerome... (I think the art professor at the University of Iowa is a different person.)

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: ok, the professor was born 1927 and is not the same person. Unclear what happened to the dancer. Thanks for the information.
